conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by four objects on a wooden floor.
Objects include a blue alarm clock (A), an egg (B), a black typewriter (C), and a carton of milk (D).
Each object casts a shadow directly beneath them, indicated by red arrows.
Assumption that light source is initially coming from directly above.
Need to consider changes in shadow position and size when light source moves to back left or right.
Objects are arranged with alarm clock (A) on the left, typewriter (C) below it, egg (B) to the right of alarm clock, and carton of milk (D) further right and slightly in front.
General rule: shadow cast in direction opposite to light source.
If light source moves to back left, objects on left cast shadows towards right, objects on right cast shadows towards left, and further objects have longer shadows.
If light source moves to back right, objects on right cast shadows towards left, objects on left cast shadows towards right, and further objects have longer shadows.
